cyclone.name: NICOLE
cyclone.current_location: about 150 mi E of Great Abaco Island, or 325 mi E of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking west-southwest toward the north-western Bahamas, then forecast to turn west-northwest and move inland along the east-central Florida coast before accelerating northward up the U.S. East Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: east-central Florida coast (within the Boca Raton to Flagler/Volusia County hurricane-warning area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and tropical-storm watches posted from Hallandale Beach FL to Boca Raton FL, Lake Okeechobee, and Flagler/Volusia County Line FL to Ponte Vedra Beach FL; storm-surge watches south of North Palm Beach FL through portions of the FL Panhandle and GA/SC coasts
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane warning for north-western Bahamas and from Boca Raton FL to Flagler/Volusia County Line FL; tropical-storm warning Hallandale Beach FL to Boca Raton FL and Flagler/Volusia County Line FL to Altamaha Sound GA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-western Bahamas, much of the east coast of Florida, and coastal Georgia/South Carolina expected to receive wind, surge, and rain impacts
weather_observation.expected_closest_date_to_port: Not expected to approach San Juan, PR
weather_observation.expected_leaving_port_date: Already well away from San Juan, PR
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None (San Juan, PR not listed in wind-probability table)
